title: Efficient Learning Strategies Using Signal Effects in Desktop Virtual Reality Learning Environments [Large-Scale]

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Virtual Reality (VR) Environment Experience and Intermediate-Level Expertise in Social Fields
context.additional_context: Conducted in a bring-your-own-device (BYOD) environment, measuring practical application abilities of learning outcomes through project-based assessment

learning_goals: In a 360° DVR environment, learners can identify visual signals (such as highlights, arrows, and color changes) and focus attention on key learning information with over 80% accuracy.
Using a DVR learning module that applies signal principles, learners can recall and explain core concepts of social studies content with over 90% accuracy.
By applying learning strategies that utilize signal effects to real workplace problem-solving, learners can achieve an average score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point scale in project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
